messages.text:
[HIRING] [REMOTE] [PART TIME]
HIDEUP is looking for a Junior Full Stack and Frontend Developer. They are utilizing AI and machine learning in the healthcare industry by implementing devices in hospitals/clinics etc. A very innovative and unique company that is growing extremely fast.

Junior Full Stack Developer: 60%/70% backend and 40% frontend (MEAN) Salary: $1000 / month - 10hrs / week. Stock options, medical/dental benefits, etc.

Junior Front End Developer: Will be 80% front end and 20% back end (MEAN). Will be working on an internal website, client dashboards/portals, and applications. Salary: $1000 / month - 10hrs / week Start-up company where you can have stock options and big growth apps. Please DM me if you are interested. Must be based in the US / Europe.

attachments.title: Work with us at the Machine Learning ⇌ Science Colaboratory (Tübingen, Germany)
attachments.text: The mlcolab is, for me, a dream come true. We talk to researchers from all disciplines, (cognitive science, plant biology, computational linguistics, environmental engineering, paleoclimatology, quantum physics, history, …) and figure out how to empower them for discovery with state-of-the-art machine learning. For us, developing free software and sharing with the world our insights on the algorithm, the dev process and the findings is an integral part of the job. We also seek to train scientis...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Work with us at the Machine Learning ⇌ Science Colaboratory (Tübingen, Germany)

messages.text:
We're looking for a new developer at Play Magnus, the software company of reigning World Chess Champion Magnus Carlsen:

<https://discourse.julialang.org/t/developer-position-at-play-magnus-computer-chess/52938>

Write to us at the e-mail address provided in the above post, or drop me a PM here on Slack for additional details.

attachments.title: Developer Position at Play Magnus (Computer Chess)
attachments.text: We’re looking to hire a few new full-time developers at Play Magnus, the software company of reigning World Chess Champion Magnus Carlsen. Play Magnus is a small company using a wide variety of technology, so it is an advantage if you are someone with a broad range of skills or are willing to learn new things without prejudice. We have user-facing web and apps in Swift, Kotlin, C# and JavaScript, with a little bit of ClojureScript and Elm. We have server-side software and content generation too...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Developer Position at Play Magnus (Computer Chess)

messages.text:
Zapata Computing is a great place, I’d recommend to anybody!  They have offices in Boston & Toronto, as well as remote people spread all over the world.
Note, full disclosure, while there is movement to Julia at Zapata, there is a lot of stuff still done in Python,
and this postdoc position would involve a lot of work in Python.
<https://zapata.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=89>

attachments.title: Industry Postdoc - jointly with University of Toronto and Zapata Computing
attachments.text: About the position: We seek an exceptional researcher for a two-year industry postdoc position in the group of Alán Aspuru-Guzik at the University of Toronto and jointly with Zapata Computing. You will be the principal researcher in a three-way-collaboration with the University of Toronto, a Fortune 500
attachments.fallback: Industry Postdoc - jointly with University of Toronto and Zapata Computing

messages.text: Hi everyone! It is with great pride that I can announce my group is hiring at Georgia Tech Research Institute! I am a researcher at the Center for Health Analytics and Informatics and we are looking for Julians! Furthermore, if you are skilled with Tableau, we are REALLY looking for folks with that skill as well. *This position is only open to US citizens.* Details in the attached image. I am right now waiting on a link for where you could apply but in the interim, if you have any questions, feel free to DM me. Once I have the link, I can share it here too.

elements.text: Hi everyone! It is with great pride that I can announce my group is hiring at Georgia Tech Research Institute! I am a researcher at the Center for Health Analytics and Informatics and we are looking for Julians! Furthermore, if you are skilled with Tableau, we are REALLY looking for folks with that skill as well.
This position is only open to US citizens.

Details in the attached image. I am right now waiting on a link for where you could apply but in the interim, if you have any questions, feel free to DM me. Once I have the link, I can share it here too.

messages.text:
Dear JL community members,
Our company is developing quantum computational algorithms and software and we are looking to expand our team with someone who has solid experience in neural network type coding in Julia. If you want to work on solving complex industry-relevant problems with cutting edge methods on the interface of quantum and classical neural networks, then this might be a very interesting opportunity for you. Experience with DiffEqFlux.jl would be a big plus. Ideally, we are looking for someone who wants to join full-time but depending on your experience we could also discuss an internship or part-time involvement. For this position relocation (to Europe) is appreciated but not a strict necessity and we are an equal opportunity employer. If you are interested, or if you know someone who might be, just send us a direct Slack message to plan an introductory video-call.
Our team is looking forward to getting to know you.

elements.text:

messages.text: <https://www.amazon.jobs/en/jobs/1418408/quantum-software-engineer-device-fabrication|https://www.amazon.jobs/en/jobs/1418408/quantum-software-engineer-device-fabrication>

attachments.title: Quantum Software Engineer - Device Fabrication
attachments.text: Interested in being part of a team that’s pushing the bounds of what’s possible with computing?The AWS Center for Quantum Computing (CQC) is looking for a senior engineer to join our growing software team. You will work closely with our device fabrication team to enable and optimize the manufacturing of quantum devices. You will also work cross-functionally with our design and measurement teams to ensure they have access to the fabrication data they need.Potential projects may include:· Working with fabrication engineers to improve component level yield· Performing data analysis to analyze device fabrication records for quality and yield improvement· Building and working with fabrication record database software· Building and maintaining interfaces to the databases to enable quick storage, retrieval and processing of fab measurements· Setting up and maintaining a monitoring system for fab tools, which includes a number of continuously operating, distributed, IoT like sensorsOn the AWS CQC software team we value people with a genuine curiosity towards new technologies. Prior experience working in the fabrication industry is required, but experience working with quantum device fabrication is not required.Work/Life BalanceAt the AWS CQC, we understand that developing quantum computing technology is a marathon, not a sprint. Mental and physical wellness is encouraged within our team and throughout AWS. The work/life integration within Amazon encourages a culture where employees work hard and have ownership over their downtime. We are exploring more structured wellness elements including meditation scheduling, running group meet-ups, and a culture of sharing wellness tips.Mentorship and Career GrowthWe are committed to the growth and development of every member of the Center for Quantum Computing. You will receive career-growth-minded management and mentorship from a software and science team and also have the opportunity to participate in Amazon's mentorship programs. You will work closely with quantum research scientists and have opportunities to learn about quantum computing technology and contribute to the development of scientific software for quantum computing at AWS.Inclusive and Diverse CultureThe AWS CQC is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds to build a world class team. We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with their peers. With quantum computing being a new and growing initiative within AWS, you would have an opportunity to make an impact on our budding team culture.
attachments.fallback: amazon.jobs: Quantum Software Engineer - Device Fabrication

messages.text:
new permanent position available in my group of Research Software Enginners at University College London: <https://atsv7.wcn.co.uk/search_engine/jobs.cgi?SID=amNvZGU9MTg3NTIzMSZ2dF90ZW1wbGF0ZT05NjUmb3duZXI9NTA0MTE3OCZvd25lcnR5cGU9ZmFpciZicmFuZF9pZD0wJmpvYl9yZWZfY29kZT0xODc1MjMxJnBvc3RpbmdfY29kZT0yMjQ=>  this round we're in particular looking for people with experience in High Performance Computing (and/or web development)

most (all?) people in my group are familiar with more than one programming language and we don't have many projects in Julia at the moment, so being proficient _only_ with Julia can be a limiting factor, but Julia is explicitly mentioned in the job description and I'm actively looking to get more Julia projects in the future, and having other fellow Julians would be helpful :grin:
